storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to detect overlapping appointments in real-time to prevent double-booking

testCases.title: Validate detection of overlapping appointments
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Scheduling interface is accessible
At least one existing appointment is present in the system (e.g., Resource A booked from 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM on current date)
System conflict detection service is running
Database contains active scheduling data

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling interface by clicking on 'Schedule' menu option
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling form is displayed with fields for appointment details including resource, date, start time, end time, and client information

steps.action: Enter appointment details that overlap with the existing appointment: Select Resource A, set date to current date, set start time to 10:30 AM, set end time to 11:30 AM, enter client name
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict within 1 second and triggers validation process

steps.action: Observe the scheduling interface for conflict alert notification
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert is displayed clearly on the UI showing message such as 'Conflict Detected: Resource A is already booked from 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM' with visual indicators (e.g., red border, warning icon)

postconditions: Conflict alert remains visible until user takes action
Overlapping appointment is not saved to the database
System remains in ready state for next scheduling action
Conflict detection event is logged in the system

testCases.title: Verify prevention of saving overlapping schedules without override
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role without override authorization
Scheduling interface is accessible
Existing appointment exists (e.g., Resource B booked from 2:00 PM to 3:00 PM on current date)
System save validation is enabled
Conflict detection service is operational

steps.action: Navigate to scheduling interface and enter overlapping appointment details: Select Resource B, set date to current date, set start time to 2:30 PM, set end time to 3:30 PM
steps.expectedResult: System detects conflict and displays conflict alert on the interface

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to attempt saving the schedule with overlapping appointment without applying any override
steps.expectedResult: System blocks the save operation and displays error message such as 'Cannot save schedule: Overlapping appointment detected. Please resolve conflict or obtain authorization to override.' Save button remains inactive or save action is prevented

steps.action: Modify the appointment to resolve the conflict by changing start time to 3:00 PM and end time to 4:00 PM
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert disappears and system validates that no conflicts exist

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to save the modified schedule
steps.expectedResult: Schedule saves successfully with confirmation message displayed such as 'Appointment saved successfully'. New appointment appears in the schedule view

postconditions: Only the non-conflicting appointment is saved in the database
Schedule displays the newly created appointment without conflicts
System returns to ready state for next scheduling operation
Save attempt and resolution are logged in audit trail

testCases.title: Check logging of detected conflicts
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Admin interface access is available for log review
Existing appointment exists (e.g., Resource C booked from 9:00 AM to 10:00 AM on current date)
Logging service is enabled and operational
System timestamp is accurate

steps.action: Navigate to scheduling interface and create an overlapping appointment: Select Resource C, set date to current date, set start time to 9:30 AM, set end time to 10:30 AM, enter client details
steps.expectedResult: System detects conflict, displays conflict alert, and triggers logging mechanism. Conflict is logged with metadata including user ID, timestamp, resource ID, conflicting time slots, and appointment details

steps.action: Navigate to admin interface by clicking 'Admin' menu, then select 'Conflict Logs' or 'Audit Logs' section
steps.expectedResult: Admin interface displays conflict logs section with searchable and filterable log entries

steps.action: Search or filter logs for the recently created conflict by date, time, or resource (Resource C)
steps.expectedResult: Log entry for the conflict is displayed showing complete details: User who triggered conflict, exact timestamp (date and time), Resource C identifier, conflicting time slots (9:30 AM - 10:30 AM overlapping with 9:00 AM - 10:00 AM), appointment IDs involved, and conflict status

steps.action: Verify the accuracy of logged information by comparing with the actual conflict details entered
steps.expectedResult: All logged conflict details are accurate and complete, matching the actual conflict scenario including correct user, timestamp within 1 second of detection, resource details, and time slot information

postconditions: Conflict log entry persists in the database
Log data is available for audit and reporting purposes
System maintains complete audit trail of conflict detection
Admin interface remains accessible for future log reviews

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to detect resource double-booking in real-time to avoid scheduling errors

testCases.title: Validate detection of resource double-booking
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Scheduling interface is accessible
Resource 'Conference Room A' is already assigned to an appointment from 1:00 PM to 2:00 PM on current date
Resource allocation service is running
Real-time validation is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling interface by selecting 'Schedule' from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling form is displayed with all required fields including resource assignment dropdown, date picker, time selectors, and appointment details fields

steps.action: Create a new appointment and assign 'Conference Room A' as the resource for the same time slot: Set date to current date, set start time to 1:00 PM, set end time to 2:00 PM, enter client and appointment details
steps.expectedResult: System detects resource double-booking within 1 second of resource assignment and initiates alert mechanism

steps.action: Observe the scheduling interface for detailed alert notification
steps.expectedResult: Detailed alert is displayed specifying the resource conflict with message such as 'Double-Booking Detected: Conference Room A is already booked from 1:00 PM to 2:00 PM on [current date]'. Alert includes resource name, conflicting time slot, and visual indicators (warning icon, highlighted fields)

postconditions: Double-booking alert remains visible until user resolves the conflict
Appointment with double-booked resource is not saved
System is ready for user to modify resource assignment
Double-booking detection event is logged with full details

testCases.title: Verify prevention of saving double-booked schedules without override
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role without authorized override privileges
Scheduling interface is accessible
Resource 'Meeting Room B' is already assigned from 11:00 AM to 12:00 PM on current date
Save validation rules are active
Double-booking detection is operational

steps.action: Navigate to scheduling interface and create appointment with double-booked resource: Select 'Meeting Room B', set date to current date, set start time to 11:00 AM, set end time to 12:00 PM, enter appointment details
steps.expectedResult: System detects double-booking and displays detailed alert specifying 'Meeting Room B' conflict with time slot details

steps.action: Attempt to save the schedule by clicking 'Save' or 'Submit' button without applying any override authorization
steps.expectedResult: System blocks the save operation and displays error message such as 'Cannot save schedule: Meeting Room B is double-booked for 11:00 AM to 12:00 PM. Please select a different resource or time, or obtain authorization to override.' Save action is prevented and appointment is not persisted

steps.action: Resolve the conflict by changing the resource assignment to 'Meeting Room C' which is available for the same time slot
steps.expectedResult: Double-booking alert disappears, system validates resource availability, and no conflicts are detected for Meeting Room C

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to save the schedule with the resolved resource assignment
steps.expectedResult: Schedule saves successfully with confirmation message 'Appointment saved successfully'. New appointment with Meeting Room C appears in the schedule view for the specified time slot

postconditions: Only the appointment with non-conflicting resource (Meeting Room C) is saved in database
Resource allocation table reflects the new assignment correctly
Schedule view displays updated appointment without double-booking
Save attempt, conflict, and resolution are logged in audit trail

testCases.title: Check logging of double-booking events
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Admin interface is accessible for log review
Resource 'Projector Unit 1' is already assigned from 3:00 PM to 4:00 PM on current date
Event logging service is enabled and functioning
System clock is synchronized and accurate

steps.action: Navigate to scheduling interface and trigger double-booking detection by assigning 'Projector Unit 1' to a new appointment: Set date to current date, set start time to 3:00 PM, set end time to 4:00 PM, complete appointment details
steps.expectedResult: System detects double-booking, displays alert, and logs the event with comprehensive metadata including user ID, timestamp, resource ID ('Projector Unit 1'), conflicting time slot (3:00 PM - 4:00 PM), appointment IDs, and detection status

steps.action: Open admin interface by navigating to 'Admin' menu and selecting 'Event Logs' or 'Double-Booking Logs' section
steps.expectedResult: Admin interface displays the event logs section with list of logged events, search functionality, and filter options by date, resource, user, or event type

steps.action: Search for the recently triggered double-booking event by filtering for 'Projector Unit 1' or by current date and time range
steps.expectedResult: Log entry for the double-booking event is displayed in the results showing: User who triggered the event, precise timestamp (date and time with seconds), Resource identifier ('Projector Unit 1'), conflicting time slot details (3:00 PM - 4:00 PM), both appointment IDs involved in the conflict, and event status

steps.action: Review and verify the accuracy and completeness of the logged event details by cross-referencing with the actual double-booking scenario
steps.expectedResult: All logged event details are accurate and complete: Correct user identification, timestamp within 1 second of actual detection time, accurate resource details, precise time slot information, both conflicting appointment references, and complete metadata. No data is missing or incorrect

postconditions: Double-booking event log entry is permanently stored in the database
Log data is available for compliance, audit, and reporting purposes
Event logging accuracy is maintained at 100%
Admin interface remains accessible for ongoing monitoring and review

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to handle concurrent scheduling inputs without missing conflicts to ensure data integrity

testCases.title: Validate conflict detection under concurrent scheduling
preconditions: Scheduling system is operational and accessible
Database has concurrency controls enabled
100 test user accounts are created and authenticated
Test environment supports concurrent connections
Baseline scheduling data exists in the database
Monitoring tools are configured to track conflicts and data integrity

steps.action: Prepare 100 concurrent scheduling requests with overlapping time slots and resources using automated test scripts or load testing tools
steps.expectedResult: Test scripts are configured correctly with overlapping scheduling inputs ready for execution

steps.action: Execute all 100 concurrent scheduling requests simultaneously
steps.expectedResult: All 100 requests are submitted to the system without connection errors or timeouts

steps.action: Monitor system processing of concurrent requests in real-time
steps.expectedResult: System processes all requests with transaction isolation, no crashes or system errors occur

steps.action: Verify that all scheduling conflicts are detected by the system
steps.expectedResult: System detects 100% of conflicts where schedules overlap in time and resources, no conflicts are missed

steps.action: Check system logs and error reports for any processing errors
steps.expectedResult: No errors, exceptions, or warnings related to concurrent processing are logged

steps.action: Query the scheduling database to verify data integrity
steps.expectedResult: All scheduling records are complete, accurate, and consistent with no duplicate or corrupted entries

steps.action: Verify no race conditions occurred by checking for orphaned records or inconsistent states
steps.expectedResult: Data integrity is maintained with no evidence of race conditions or data corruption

steps.action: Check that conflict alerts were generated for all detected conflicts
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alerts are created in the system for every detected scheduling conflict

steps.action: Verify conflict alerts are delivered to all affected users
steps.expectedResult: All users involved in scheduling conflicts receive their respective conflict notifications

steps.action: Measure the time taken for conflict detection and alert delivery
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detection and alert delivery complete within 2 seconds under concurrent load

steps.action: Review alert content for accuracy and completeness
steps.expectedResult: Alerts contain correct conflict details including time, resource, and conflicting parties

postconditions: All scheduling conflicts are accurately detected and recorded
Database maintains complete data integrity with no corruption
All affected users have received conflict notifications
System remains stable and operational
Test data can be cleaned up or retained for analysis

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to validate scheduling inputs to prevent invalid data entry causing false conflicts

testCases.title: Verify validation of scheduling inputs
preconditions: Scheduling system is accessible and operational
User is logged in with scheduler privileges
Scheduling input form is loaded and ready
Input validation rules are configured on frontend and backend
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling input form
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling form is displayed with all required fields visible and enabled

steps.action: Enter an invalid date format in the date field (e.g., '32/13/2024' or 'abc123')
steps.expectedResult: Inline error message is displayed immediately below or next to the date field indicating invalid date format

steps.action: Measure the time taken for the validation error to appear
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message appears within 500 milliseconds of input

steps.action: Verify the error message content and clarity
steps.expectedResult: Error message clearly states the expected date format (e.g., 'Please enter date in MM/DD/YYYY format')

steps.action: Attempt to submit the form with the invalid date
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is prevented, error message persists, and focus remains on the invalid field

steps.action: Correct the date field with a valid date format
steps.expectedResult: Error message disappears and field is marked as valid

steps.action: Enter a start time that is after the end time (e.g., start: 3:00 PM, end: 2:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error message is displayed indicating that start time must be before end time

steps.action: Measure the time taken for the validation error to appear
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message appears within 500 milliseconds of completing the end time input

steps.action: Attempt to submit the form with start time after end time
steps.expectedResult: Validation error prevents form submission and displays clear error message

steps.action: Verify the error message provides clear guidance
steps.expectedResult: Error message states 'Start time must be before end time' or similar clear instruction

steps.action: Correct the time fields so start time is before end time
steps.expectedResult: Validation error disappears and time fields are marked as valid

steps.action: Enter all valid inputs in the scheduling form (valid date format, start time before end time, valid resource identifiers)
steps.expectedResult: No validation errors are displayed, all fields show valid status

steps.action: Submit the form with all valid inputs
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is allowed and proceeds successfully to conflict detection phase

steps.action: Verify the submitted data is processed correctly
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling request is accepted and confirmation message or next step is displayed

postconditions: Invalid inputs are rejected and not stored in the database
Valid scheduling data is successfully submitted
User receives appropriate feedback for all validation scenarios
System maintains data quality by preventing invalid entries
Form is ready for next scheduling input
